sen.j: 湯沐邑（とうもくゆう、ゆのむら）は、古代の中国と、飛鳥時代から平安時代までの日本で、一部の皇族に与えられた領地である。
sen.e: Tomokuyu or Yunomura was a territory which was given to a part of the Imperial family in the ancient China and Japan from the Asuka period to the Heian period.
Tomokuyu or Yunomura was a territory which was given to a part of the Imperial Family in the ancient China and Japan from the Asuka period to the Heian period.
sen.cmt: Imperial family → Imperial Family に訂正しました。
sen.e: Tomokuyu or Yunomura was a territory which was given to a part of the Imperial Family in the ancient China and Japan from the Asuka period to the Heian period.

sen.j: 国と時代により実態が大きく異なる。
sen.e: Its actual condition differed significantly depending on countries and times.
Its actual condition differed significantly depending on countries and times.
Its actual condition differed significantly depending on countries and times.

tit.j: 中国の湯沐邑（とうもくゆう）

sen.j: 湯沐邑は周の制度として始まった。
sen.e: Tomokuyu began as Zouh's system.
Tomokuyu began as a system in Zhou.
sen.cmt: Zouh's system → a system in Zhou に訂正しました。
sen.e: Tomokuyu began as a system in Zhou.

sen.j: 文献初見は『春秋公羊伝』隠公3年3月条である。
sen.e: It first appeared in an article of "March, three years of the Inko era" in "Shunju Kuyo-den" (Annotation of Gongyang on Spring and Autumn Annals).
It first appeared in an article of "March, three years of the Inko era" in "Shunju Kuyo-den" (Annotation of Gongyang on Spring and Autumn Annals).
sen.cmt: カッコ内側の空白を削除しました。
sen.e: It first appeared in an article of "March, three years of the Inko era" in "Shunju Kuyo-den" (Annotation of Gongyang on Spring and Autumn Annals).

sen.j: そこでは、邴（へい）は鄭の湯沐邑であるとして、湯沐邑について解説する。
sen.e: In the article, Hei is said to be Zheng's Tomokuyu and there is an explanation about Tomokuyu.
In the article, Hei is said to be Zheng's Tomokuyu and there is an explanation about Tomokuyu.
In the article, Hei is said to be Zheng's Tomokuyu and there is an explanation about Tomokuyu.

sen.j: それによれば天子が泰山を祭るとき、諸侯もみな泰山の下に従う。
sen.e: According to it, when the Emperor enshrined Mt.Tai, all lords went there and joined the ceremony.
According to the article, when the Emperor enshrined Mt.Tai, all lords went there and joined the ceremony.
According to the article, when the Emperor enshrined Mt.Tai, all lords went there and joined the ceremony.

sen.j: そのとき諸侯はみな湯沐のために邑を持つという。
sen.e: At that time, all of them had Yu (people and land) for Tomoku (bathing and preparation for the sacred ceremony).
At that time, all of them had Yu (people and the land) for Tomoku (bathing and preparation for the sacred ceremony).
sen.cmt: カッコ内側の空白を削除しました。 land → the land に訂正しました。
sen.e: At that time, all of them had Yu (people and the land) for Tomoku (bathing and preparation for the sacred ceremony).

sen.j: また『礼記』王制篇に、方伯が天子に朝するときにはみな天子の県内に湯沐の邑を持つとある。
sen.e: The volume about a system of monarchy in "Raiki" (Book of Rites) also said that when heads of lords presented themselves to the Emperor, all of them had Yu for Tomoku in the Emperor's country.
The volume about a system of monarchy in "Raiki" (Book of Rites) also said that when heads of lords presented themselves to the Emperor, all of them had Yu for Tomoku in the Emperor's country.
sen.cmt: カッコ内側の空白を削除しました。
sen.e: The volume about a system of monarchy in "Raiki" (Book of Rites) also said that when heads of lords presented themselves to the Emperor, all of them had Yu for Tomoku in the Emperor's country.

sen.j: どちらも斎戒沐浴を名目とするが、遠くから来る諸侯と従者、使者の滞在に必要なものを、現地で満たすために与えられたのであろう。
sen.e: Both Tomokuyu were for purifying and preparing for the event in name, but virtually they were given to lords, their attendants, and their messengers, who came from far away, for providing them with things they needed to stay.

Both Tomokuyu were for purifying and preparing for the event in name, but virtually they were given to lords, their attendants, and their messengers, who came from far away, for providing them with things they needed to stay.

Both Tomokuyu were for purifying and preparing for the event in name, but virtually they were given to lords, their attendants, and their messengers, who came from far away, for providing them with things they needed to stay.

tit.j: 戦国時代と漢代の湯沐邑
tit.e: Tomokuyu in the Warring States period and the age of the Han dynasty
Tomokuyu in the Warring States period and the age of the Han dynasty
Tomokuyu in the Warring States period and the age of the Han dynasty

sen.j: 戦国時代 (中国)には、湯沐邑は君主が与える領地を意味するものになった。
sen.e: In the Warring States period (in China), Tomokuyu came to mean a territory which a monarch gave.
In the Warring States period (in China), Tomokuyu came to mean a territory given by a monarch.
sen.cmt: カッコ内側の空白を削除しました。 which a monarch gave. → given by a monarch に変更しました。
sen.e: In the Warring States period (in China), Tomokuyu came to mean a territory given by a monarch.

sen.j: 魏無忌（信陵君）が趙の王から鄗（こう）を湯沐邑として与えられたことが、『史記』信陵君伝にある。
sen.e: It is mentioned that Gi Muki (Shinryokun) was given Ko as Tomokuyu by the king of Zhao in Shinryokun's biography in Shiki (the Chinese Historical Records).
It is mentioned that Gi Muki (Shinryokun) was given Ko as Tomokuyu by the king of Zhao in Shinryokun's biography in Shiki (the Chinese Historical Records).
sen.cmt: カッコ内側の空白を削除しました。
sen.e: It is mentioned that Gi Muki (Shinryokun) was given Ko as Tomokuyu by the king of Zhao in Shinryokun's biography in Shiki (the Chinese Historical Records).

sen.j: 前漢の高祖劉邦は皇帝になってから、「朕は沛公からはじめて暴虐を誅し、ついに天下を得た」として、挙兵の地である沛を自分の湯沐邑にして、沛の税や労役負担を軽減した。
sen.e: When the Emperor of Gaozu Liu Bang of the Former Han took the throne, he said "At first, I was named Haiko, then I defeated tyranny, and finally I came to power." and he made Hai, where he raised an army, his own Tomokuyu to reduce taxes and labor service.

When the Emperor of Gaozu Liu Bang of the Former Han took the throne, he said "At first, I was named Haiko, then I defeated tyranny, and finally I came to power." and he made Hai, where he raised an army, his own Tomokuyu to reduce taxes and labor service.

When the Emperor of Gaozu Liu Bang of the Former Han took the throne, he said "At first, I was named Haiko, then I defeated tyranny, and finally I came to power." and he made Hai, where he raised an army, his own Tomokuyu to reduce taxes and labor service.

sen.j: 皇帝の湯沐邑はこの一例のみで、その後は皇族が湯沐邑を与えられた。
sen.e: This was the only example of the Emperor's own Tomokuyu, and after that the Imperial family was given Tomokuyu.
This was the only example of the Emperor's own Tomokuyu, and after that the Imperial Family was given Tomokuyu.
This was the only example of the Emperor's own Tomokuyu, and after that the Imperial Family was given Tomokuyu.

sen.j: 前・後の漢代に湯沐邑を与えられたのは、皇太子、皇后、皇太后、廃王、廃王女、公主、王女、皇后の生母である。
sen.e: In the age of the Former and Later Han, Tomokuyu was given to a crown prince, the Empress, the Empress Dowager, a retired king, a retired princess, a king, a princess, and the Empress' real mother.
In the age of the Former and Later Han, Tomokuyu was given to a crown prince, the Empress, the Empress Dowager, a retired king, a retired princess, a king, a princess, and the Empress' real mother.
In the age of the Former and Later Han, Tomokuyu was given to a crown prince, the Empress, the Empress Dowager, a retired king, a retired princess, a king, a princess, and the Empress' real mother.

sen.j: 太子の湯沐は、『後漢書』班彪伝に、旧制で10県とある。
sen.e: Prince was said to have ten countries as Tomokuyu under the old system in the Hanryu's biography in "Gokanjo"(historical records of the Later Han Dynasty).
Prince was said to have ten countries as Tomokuyu under the old system in the Hanryu's biography in "Gokanjo" (historical records of the Later Han Dynasty).
sen.cmt: カッコ内側の空白を削除しました。
sen.e: Prince was said to have ten countries as Tomokuyu under the old system in the Hanryu's biography in "Gokanjo" (historical records of the Later Han Dynasty).

sen.j: 後に増やされたらしく、『漢旧儀』には、皇后・太子は各40県を食み、湯沐邑というとある。
sen.e: They might be increased later, so "Kankyugi" (a book of traditional ceremonies and systems) said that the Empress and Prince got 40 countries each and called them Tomokuyu.

The number of Tomokuyu might have been increased later, and "Kankyugi" (a book of traditional ceremonies and systems) says that the Empress and the Prince got 40 countries each and called them Tomokuyu.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくするため、They → The number of Tomokuyu に訂正しました。 might be increased → might have been increased （文法ミスと思われます。） so → and、said → says、Prince → the Prince に訂正しました。カッコ内側の空白を削除しました。
sen.e: The number of Tomokuyu might have been increased later, and "Kankyugi" (a book of traditional ceremonies and systems) says that the Empress and the Prince got 40 countries each and called them Tomokuyu.

sen.j: 漢代の皇族男子は通常諸侯・王や列侯になって、与えられた領地を統治したが、それ以外の皇族には湯沐邑が与えられた。
sen.e: The Imperial son in Han usually became lords and king to reign his territory, and other Imperial family was given Tomokuyu.
The Imperial son in Han usually became lords and king to reign his territory, and other Imperial Family was given Tomokuyu.
sen.cmt: Imperial family → Imperial Family に訂正しました。
sen.e: The Imperial son in Han usually became lords and king to reign his territory, and other Imperial Family was given Tomokuyu.

sen.j: 湯沐邑の主は統治権を持たず、税収を手に入れるだけだった。
sen.e: An owner of Tomokuyu didn't have sovereignty and only got tax income.
An owner of Tomokuyu didn't have sovereignty and only got tax income.
An owner of Tomokuyu didn't have sovereignty and only got tax income.

sen.j: 湯沐邑を与えられるのが皇族女子と廃王に偏るのはこのためである。
sen.e: This is why the Imperial daughters and retired kings could partially get Tomokuyu.
This is why only the Imperial daughters and retired kings could get Tomokuyu.
sen.cmt: 誤訳のため、左記のように変更しました。
sen.e: This is why only the Imperial daughters and retired kings could get Tomokuyu.

tit.j: 日本の湯沐邑（とうもくゆう、ゆのむら）

sen.j: 湯沐邑の用例として最も古い時代を参照するものとしては、平安時代に作られた『新撰姓氏録』に、「諸国に多治部を定めて皇子の湯沐邑にした」とある。
sen.e: The oldest reference to an example of Tomokuyu was in "Shinsen Shojiroku" (Newly Compiled Register of Clan Names and Titles of Nobility) composed in the Heian period, saying "Tajibe (people who are privately owned by the Emperor and in charge of education for the Prince) was set in various districts to be Prince's Tomokuyu."

The oldest reference to an example of Tomokuyu was in "Shinsen Shojiroku" (Newly Compiled Register of Clan Names and Titles of Nobility) composed in the Heian period, saying "Tajibe (people who are privately owned by the Emperor and in charge of education for the Prince) was set in various districts to be Prince's Tomokuyu."
sen.cmt: カッコ内側の空白を削除しました。
sen.e: The oldest reference to an example of Tomokuyu was in "Shinsen Shojiroku" (Newly Compiled Register of Clan Names and Titles of Nobility) composed in the Heian period, saying "Tajibe (people who are privately owned by the Emperor and in charge of education for the Prince) was set in various districts to be Prince's Tomokuyu."

sen.j: この皇子は後の反正天皇にあたる。
sen.e: That Prince was later Emperor Hanzei.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: That Prince was later Emperor Hanzei.
That Prince was later Emperor Hanzei.

sen.j: 多治部を宰領した者が丹比連を名乗ったのが丹比氏のはじまりとと伝える。
sen.e: The Tajihi family are said to begin with a man who supervised Tajibe and named himself Tajihi-muraji (a hereditary title).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Tajihi family is said to have begun with a man who supervised Tajibe and named himself Tajihi no muraji (a hereditary title).
sen.cmt: are said to begin → is said to have begun に訂正しました。丹比連の読みは「たじひのむらじ」です。カッコ内側の空白を削除しました。
sen.e: The Tajihi family is said to have begun with a man who supervised Tajibe and named himself Tajihi no muraji (a hereditary title).

sen.j: しかしこれは、5世紀に湯沐邑があった証拠にはならず、名代・子代を平安時代の制度に呼び替えたものと思われる。
sen.e: However this could not be evidence of Tomokuyu existing in the 5th century, and seemed that the name of Nashiro and Koshiro was changed to Tomokuyu adapting to a system in the Heian period.
However this does not prove that Tomokuyu existed in the 5th century, and it seems that the name of Nashiro and Koshiro were changed to Tomokuyu to adapt to a system in the Heian period.
sen.cmt: 訳を多少自然にするため、文の構成を変えました。
sen.e: However this does not prove that Tomokuyu existed in the 5th century, and it seems that the name of Nashiro and Koshiro were changed to Tomokuyu to adapt to a system in the Heian period.

tit.j: 壬申の乱の時の湯沐邑
tit.e: Tomokuyu at the time of the Jinshin War
Tomokuyu at the time of the Jinshin War
Tomokuyu at the time of the Jinshin War

sen.j: 『日本書紀』巻28、いわゆる「壬申紀」は、天武天皇元年（672年）の一年間を記し、そのほとんどを壬申の乱にあてる。
sen.e: Volume 28 of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), which is called 'Jinsinki', recorded the First Year of Emperor Tenmu (672) and most of its sections were allotted to the Jinshin War.
Volume 28 of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), which is called 'Jinsinki', recorded the First Year of Emperor Tenmu (672) and most of its sections were allotted to the Jinshin War.
sen.cmt: カッコ内側の空白を削除しました。
sen.e: Volume 28 of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), which is called 'Jinsinki', recorded the First Year of Emperor Tenmu (672) and most of its sections were allotted to the Jinshin War.

sen.j: その中に湯沐令への言及が2箇所、湯沐への言及が1箇所ある。
sen.e: There are two references to Yunonagashi (a post of supervisor for Tomokuyu) and one reference to Tomoku.
There are two references to Yunonagashi (a post of supervisor for Tomokuyu) and one reference to Tomoku.
sen.cmt: カッコ内側の空白を削除しました。
sen.e: There are two references to Yunonagashi (a post of supervisor for Tomokuyu) and one reference to Tomoku.

sen.j: 「湯沐邑」という語そのものは見えないが、「湯沐」や「湯沐令」は湯沐邑から派生した語なので、元となる湯沐邑もあったと考えられる。
sen.e: The word 'Tomokuyu' itself isn't seen in the chronicles but the words 'Tomoku' and 'Yunonagashi' were derived from Tomokuyu, so the original Tomokuyu is considered to have existed at that time.
The word 'Tomokuyu' itself is not seen in the chronicles but since the words 'Tomoku' and 'Yunonagashi' were derived from Tomokuyu, the original Tomokuyu is considered to have existed at that time.
sen.cmt: isn't → is not に変更しました。文中のsoをなくして、butの後にsince を入れました。
sen.e: The word 'Tomokuyu' itself is not seen in the chronicles but since the words 'Tomoku' and 'Yunonagashi' were derived from Tomokuyu, the original Tomokuyu is considered to have existed at that time.

sen.j: その時代に中国を支配した唐王朝に湯沐邑はなかったので、日本の「湯沐邑」は漢代の制度からとったと思われる。
sen.e: The Tang Dynasty, which conquered China at the age, had no Tomokuyu, so Japanese 'Tomokuyu' seemed to be introduced from a system in the age of the Han dynasty.
Because the Tang Dynasty, which conquered China at the age, had no Tomokuyu, Japanese 'Tomokuyu' seems to have been introduced from a system in the age of the Han dynasty.
sen.cmt: Because を文頭に置き、文中のsoをなくしました。 seemed → seems に訂正しました。 to be introduced → to have been introduced に訂正しました。
sen.e: Because the Tang Dynasty, which conquered China at the age, had no Tomokuyu, Japanese 'Tomokuyu' seems to have been introduced from a system in the age of the Han dynasty.

sen.j: 大海人皇子は自ら行動を起こす2日前、6月22日に使者を出し、安八磨郡（安八郡）の湯沐令（ゆのうながし）の多品治に兵を挙げて不破道を塞ぐよう命じた。
sen.e: Prince Oama sent an envoy to Yunonagashi of Ahachimanokoori (Anpachi District), O no Honji on June 22nd, two days before he took action by himself, and ordered him to raise an army to block the road of Fuwa.

Prince Oama sent an envoy to O no Honji, a Yunonagashi of Ahachimanokoori (Anpachi District), on June 22, two days before he took action by himself, and ordered him to raise an army to block the road of Fuwa.
sen.cmt: カッコ内側の空白を削除しました。"O no Honji" と"Yunonagashi of Ahachimanokooori" の語順を入れ替えました。Yunonagashi の前に冠詞をつけました。日付の22nd を単に22としました。
sen.e: Prince Oama sent an envoy to O no Honji, a Yunonagashi of Ahachimanokoori (Anpachi District), on June 22, two days before he took action by himself, and ordered him to raise an army to block the road of Fuwa.

sen.j: これを受けて25日までに美濃の兵3000が大海人皇子のために不破道をふさいだ。
sen.e: Following this order, 3000 soldiers of Mino Province blocked the road for Prince Oama by the 25th.
Following this order, 3000 soldiers of Mino Province blocked the road for Prince Oama by the 25th.
Following this order, 3000 soldiers of Mino Province blocked the road for Prince Oama by the 25th.

sen.j: この兵を湯沐邑の兵力とみる説と、美濃国全体の兵力とする説とがあるが、いずれの場合でも安八磨郡の湯沐邑が真っ先に軍事行動を起こしたことは確実である。
sen.e: One theory is that soldiers were said to be from Tomokuyu and in another theory the soldiers are from the whole Mino Province, but with either theory, it was certain that Tomokuyu of Ahachimanokoori raised the army first.

One theory is that soldiers were said to be from Tomokuyu and in another theory the soldiers are from the whole Mino Province, but with either theory, it is certain that Tomokuyu of Ahachimanokoori raised the army first.
sen.cmt: it was certain → it is certain に訂正しました。
sen.e: One theory is that soldiers were said to be from Tomokuyu and in another theory the soldiers are from the whole Mino Province, but with either theory, it is certain that Tomokuyu of Ahachimanokoori raised the army first.

sen.j: 24日、皇子は伊勢に向かう途中で、莬田郡家のそばで湯沐の米を運ぶ伊勢国の駄50匹に会った。
sen.e: On the 24th, near Uda public office on the way to Ise Province, Prince Oama happened to see 50 draft horses which carried rice of Tomokuyu to Ise Province.
sen.cmt: 原文中「湯沐」は「湯沐邑」を指すものと思われます。
sen.e: On the 24th, near Uda public office on the way to Ise Province, Prince Oama happened to see 50 draft horses which carried rice of Tomokuyu to Ise Province.
On the 24th, near Uda public office on the way to Ise Province, Prince Oama happened to see 50 draft horses which carried rice of Tomokuyu to Ise Province.

sen.j: 25日、伊勢の鈴鹿郡家で、国司守の三宅石床、介の三輪子首、湯沐令の田中足麻呂、高田新家が出迎えた。
sen.e: On the 25th, a head of local officers, MIYAKE no Iwatoko; a vice-head of the local officers, MIWA no Kobito; Yunonagashi, TANAKA no Tarimaro and TAKATA no Niinomi, met Prince Oama at Suzuka public office in Ise Province.

On the 25th, MIYAKE no Iwatoko, a head of local officers,; MIWA no Kobito, a vice-head of the local officers,; TANAKA no Tarimaro and TAKATA no Niinomi, Yunonagashi, met Prince Oama at Suzuka public office in Ise Province.
sen.cmt: 名前と役職名の語順を入れ替えました。
sen.e: On the 25th, MIYAKE no Iwatoko, a head of local officers,; MIWA no Kobito, a vice-head of the local officers,; TANAKA no Tarimaro and TAKATA no Niinomi, Yunonagashi, met Prince Oama at Suzuka public office in Ise Province.

sen.j: 後の律令制の下での食封の規模をあてはめれば、湯沐邑は安八磨郡の一部ではなく、郡全体にあたるのではないかと考えられ、その郡の範囲は後の池田郡を含み、さらに広かった可能性もある。
sen.e: Taking into account a scale of Jikifu (a vassal household allotted to courtier, shrines and temples) under the later Ritsuryo system, Tomokuyu at that time seems to have not been a part of Ahachimanokoori but a whole district, and range of the district included later Ikeda District, possibly wider.

Taking into account a scale of Jikifu (a vassal household allotted to courtier, shrines and temples) under the later Ritsuryo system, Tomokuyu at that time seems to have not been a part of Ahachimanokoori but a whole district, and range of the district included later Ikeda District, possibly wider.
sen.cmt: カッコ内側の空白を削除しました。
sen.e: Taking into account a scale of Jikifu (a vassal household allotted to courtier, shrines and temples) under the later Ritsuryo system, Tomokuyu at that time seems to have not been a part of Ahachimanokoori but a whole district, and range of the district included later Ikeda District, possibly wider.

sen.j: 田中足麻呂については、多品治と同じく安八磨郡の湯沐邑の令だったとする説と、伊勢国に別の湯沐邑があったとする説がある。
sen.e: There is two theories about TANAKA no Tarimaro, one says he was the same Yunonagashi of Ahachimanokoori as O no Honji, another says there was the other Tomokuyu in Ise Province and he was there.
There is two theories about TANAKA no Tarimaro; one says he was the same Yunonagashi of Ahachimanokoori as O no Honji, another says there was the other Tomokuyu in Ise Province and he was there.
sen.cmt: 最初のコンマをセミコロンに変えました。
sen.e: There is two theories about TANAKA no Tarimaro; one says he was the same Yunonagashi of Ahachimanokoori as O no Honji, another says there was the other Tomokuyu in Ise Province and he was there.

sen.j: 後の律令制の湯沐邑は収入源でしかないが、この頃の湯沐邑と皇子との関係には密接なものがあったと推察される。
sen.e: Tomokuyu under the Ritsuryo system was only a source of revenue, but the Tomokuyu at that time are supposed to have had a close relationship with the Prince.
Tomokuyu under the Ritsuryo system was only a source of revenue, but the Tomokuyu at that time are supposed to have had a close relationship with the Prince.
Tomokuyu under the Ritsuryo system was only a source of revenue, but the Tomokuyu at that time are supposed to have had a close relationship with the Prince.

sen.j: 律令制度では、東宮（皇太子）と中宮（皇后）のために湯沐邑が置かれた。
sen.e: Tomokuyu was set for Togu (crown prince) and Chugu (the Empress) in the Ritsuryo system.
Tomokuyu was set for Togu (crown prince) and Chugu (the Empress) in the Ritsuryo system.
sen.cmt: カッコ内側の空白を削除しました。
sen.e: Tomokuyu was set for Togu (crown prince) and Chugu (the Empress) in the Ritsuryo system.

sen.j: 大宝律令、養老律令制定時には中宮のみ2000戸の湯沐邑が置かれ、後になって東宮2000戸が追加されたらしい。
sen.e: When Taiho Ritsuryo Code and Yoro Ritsuryo Code were established, 2000 houses of Tomokuyu may have been allotted for only Chugu and later 2000 houses may have been added for Togu.
When Taiho Ritsuryo Code and Yoro Ritsuryo Code were established, 2000 houses of Tomokuyu may have been allotted for only Chugu and later 2000 houses may have been added for Togu.
When Taiho Ritsuryo Code and Yoro Ritsuryo Code were established, 2000 houses of Tomokuyu may have been allotted for only Chugu and later 2000 houses may have been added for Togu.

sen.j: 令制では別に封戸があり、他の皇族と臣下に与えられた。
sen.e: There was Fuko (houses as a salary) besides Tomokuyu in the Ritsuryo system to give to the other Imperial family members and subjects.
There was Fuko (houses as a salary) besides Tomokuyu in the Ritsuryo system to give to the other Imperial family members and subjects.
sen.cmt: カッコ内側の空白を削除しました。
sen.e: There was Fuko (houses as a salary) besides Tomokuyu in the Ritsuryo system to give to the other Imperial family members and subjects.

sen.j: 封戸と湯沐は呼び方の違いであり、実質は同じである。
sen.e: Fuko and Tomokuyu have different names, but are practically the same thing.
sen.cmt: 原文中「湯沐」は「湯沐邑」を指すものと思われます。
sen.e: Fuko and Tomokuyu are different names, but are practically the same thing.
sen.cmt: 原文に忠実に訳すと、have → are ではないかと思われます。
sen.e: Fuko and Tomokuyu are different names, but are practically the same thing.
